rename.from: Multiple validateAttribute() calls when scenarios() returns duplicate attribute
rename.to: Multiple validateAttribute() calls when scenarios() returns duplicate attributes

body:
This is the case indeed.

While this can be fixed in several places with simple `array_unique` I think the best place for this is [Model::activeAttributes()](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/base/Model.php#L776) because both [Model::validate()](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/base/Model.php#L337) and [Validator::validateAttributes()](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/validators/Validator.php#L247) should take duplicated attribute names as arguments if set directly and process them as many times as developer wants.

I can prepare PR.

issue.title: Prevent multiple validateAttribute() calls when scenarios() returns duplicate attributes

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | yes
| New feature?  | no
| Breaks BC?    | probably no
| Tests pass?   | locally yes, travis fails on PHP7 and and PHP5.5 (probably a fluke)
| Fixed issues  | #14134

body: @bizley I agree fully, but could you let me have this one? :)
This usecase doesnt feel right. This problem should solved at the source instead of monkey patching afterwards in the core.

This is the first place where you can correct the array (the `scenarios()` method can be overriden so fixing this in parent is useless). The only other options are:
- introduce new method (or any other process) that will fix the list (overkill IMHO),
- teach developers not to duplicate attributes in `scenarios()` :trollface:
isnt it quite obvious not to duplicate attributes in arrays, like in every array you define?
When defining array directly - yes. But when merging array with parent's version it's not.
the duplication starts at the moment of the merge, so I would expect the 'repair' logic to happen over there.
Forcing the client to make the array unique at the merge level in `scenarios()` is in my opinion boilerplate that could be avoided
